title: Job Openings at SOLEVO Group
content:
SOLEVO Group is a leading distributor of chemicals and inputs for specific industrial and agricultural segments in Africa. SOLEVO assists African farmers and Industries succeed by providing them with a full range of fertilisers, seeds, crop protection products and industrial chemicals they need with a guaranteed quality and good value.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Research & Development Manager - Printing Ink

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
What are we looking for?
     

            
    




	We are looking for an experienced and visionary Research & Development Manager (Printing Ink) to lead the innovation, formulation, and process development efforts for our printing ink division.
	You will spearhead new product development, technical support, and process optimization initiatives, ensuring we meet evolving customer demands with superior technical performance and efficiency.


What do we expect from the candidate?


	You will join our Printing Ink business unit, playing a critical leadership role in formulation design, lab management, and technical service.
	Your ability to work across flexographic and gravure printing platforms and to deliver high-performance, cost-effective ink systems will be key to your success. You will also oversee laboratory operations, ensuring quality control and regulatory compliance while collaborating with production, commercial, and customer service teams.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and optimize ink formulations for flexo and gravure printing applications, focusing on both water- and solvent-based technologies.
	Lead new product development projects, from concept through commercialization.
	Ensure color matching, drying behavior, adhesion, and print performance through rigorous lab testing.
	Continuously improve manufacturing processes for quality consistency, cost reduction, and efficiency gains.
	Provide technical service and troubleshooting during customer trials and post-sale support.
	Supervise lab operations, including raw material testing, quality assurance, and safety standards.
	Collaborate cross-functionally with sales, production, and supply chain teams to align R&D efforts with market needs.


Requirements
Must-Have:


	Master’s or Ph.D. in Chemistry, Polymer Science, or related fields.
	15+ years of hands-on experience in printing ink formulation and technical service, preferably in packaging applications.
	Deep technical knowledge of resins, pigments, solvents, additives, and formulation strategies.
	In-depth understanding of printing processes (flexographic, gravure) and press-side application.


Nice-to-Have:


	Experience in sustainable formulation trends, including low-VOC and bio-based inks.
	Understanding of best manufacturing practices, regulatory compliance, and environmental standards.
	Familiarity with regional and global ink markets and customer expectations.


If you are…


	A problem solver with strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.
	A collaborative leader who can communicate technical concepts to both R&D teams and non-technical stakeholders.
	Passionate about innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction.
	Able to manage priorities in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Sales Manager, Solvents

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
What are we looking for?


	We are seeking an experienced Sales Manager – Solvents to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have a robust background in solvent sales, strategic planning, and market analysis, with strong technical knowledge of different types of solvents and their applications.


What do we expect from the candidate?


	The candidate will be part of our sales team; you will play a key role in driving sales, developing new business opportunities, and managing customer relationships in the chemical and solvent industry.


The Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities in the solvent market.
	Achieve sales targets and revenue growth.
	Develop and implement sales strategies for different types of solvents.
	Maintain relationships with existing clients and expand the customer base.


Requirements
Must-Have:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Business Administration or a related field.
	At least 8 years of experience in sales, preferably in the chemical or solvent industry.
	Strong knowledge of different types of solvents and their applications.


Nice-to-Have:


	Strong negotiation and communication skills.
	Sales and business development expertise.
	Analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Soft Skills:
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a proactive approach to troubleshooting.
	Understanding of regulatory requirements in the chemical industry.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


If you are…


	A self-starter with strong analytical skills and the ability to translate technical data into actionable market strategies.
	An excellent communicator who can build trust and influence decision-makers at all levels.
	A team player who thrives in dynamic, multicultural environments.
	A continuous learner who stays up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Agrochemical Sales Representative

Job Location: Lagos, Lagos, Nigeria
Job Type: Hybrid
Job Family: Operations Support

Job Description
What are we looking for?


	We are seeking a results-driven and customer-focused Agrochemicals Sales Representative to join our team.
	The ideal candidate is passionate about agriculture, understands crop protection and soil health products, and is motivated to build long-term relationships with farmers, distributors, and stakeholders within the agricultural value chain.


What do we expect from the candidate?


	A proactive approach to identifying and pursuing sales opportunities.
	Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage, influence, and build trust with customers.
	A solid understanding of agrochemical products and their application in crop production.
	The discipline to achieve sales targets while adhering to company policies and industry regulations.
	Willingness to travel frequently within assigned territories.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell agrochemical products to farmers, cooperatives, distributors, and retailers.
	Conduct product demonstrations, field trials, and training sessions for clients
	Provide technical advice and after-sales support to customers.
	Achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets.
	Monitor market trends, competitors’ activities, and customer needs to identify new business opportunities.
	Maintain accurate records of sales, customer interactions, and market intelligence.
	Collaborate with the marketing and technical teams to implement promotional activities.


Requirements
Must-Have:


	Bachelor’s Degree in agriculture, Agronomy, Crop Science.
	Minimum of 1 –3 years of experience in agrochemicals or agricultural input sales.
	Good knowledge of crop protection products, fertilizers, and modern farming practices.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Valid driver’s license and willingness to travel extensively.


Nice-to-Have:


	Experience working directly with smallholder farmers and cooperatives.
	Familiarity with precision agriculture tools and digital platforms for sales.
	Multilingual skills (local languages and English)
	Established network within the agricultural sector.


If you are…


	Passionate about agriculture and supporting farmers.
	Motivated by results and enjoy building relationships.
	A problem-solver with a hands-on approach.
	Eager to grow your career in a dynamic, field-driven environment.


Click here to apply online
